fields.description:
Hi All,

With DNS delegation enabled and eucalyptus subdomain configured in master DNS server, if the master DNS server sends a AAAA or TXT query the CLC always returns A response, which does not match with what RFC 4074 says:

"
Suppose that an authoritative server has an A RR but has no AAAA RR for a host name.  Then, the server should return a response to a query for an AAAA RR of the name with the response code (RCODE) being 0 (indicating no error) and with an empty answer section (see Sections 4.3.2 and 6.2.4 of [1]).  Such a response indicates that there is at least one RR of a different type than AAAA for the queried name, and the stub resolver can then look for A RRs."

Please note RFC 4074 specifically focus on AAAA queries but similar results are seen for TXT as well.

Environment details:

DNS server IP: 192.168.35.17
CLC server IP: 192.168.40.16
DNS client   : 192.168.35.15
Primary DNS domain: jeevanullas.in
Eucalyptus domain: euca.jeevanullas.in

Master DNS server is authoritative for jeevanullas.in and CLC is suppose to be authoritative for euca.jeevanullas.in

On DNS client following is the result

$ dig @192.168.35.17 euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.3.6-P1-RedHat-9.3.6-16.P1.el5_7.1 <<>> @192.168.35.17 euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in AAAA
; (1 server found)
;; global options:  printcmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 45548
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
 
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. IN AAAA
 
;; Query time: 56 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.35.17#53(192.168.35.17)
;; WHEN: Wed Jun 13 00:33:12 2012
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 68

Not that it returns a SERVFAIL

The tcpdump on the Master DNS server is shown below:

tcpdump -i eth1 -n udp port 53
tcpdump: verbose output suppressed, use -v or -vv for full protocol decode
listening on eth1, link-type EN10MB (Ethernet), capture size 65535 bytes
00:35:04.855018 IP 192.168.35.15.60777 > 192.168.35.17.domain: 45548+ AAAA? euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. (68)
00:35:04.855671 IP 192.168.35.17.38488 > 192.168.40.16.domain: 16530+ [1au] AAAA? euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. (79)
00:35:04.910381 IP 192.168.40.16.domain > 192.168.35.17.38488: 16530*- 1/1/1 A 192.168.61.110 (114)
00:35:04.910534 IP 192.168.35.17.domain > 192.168.35.15.60777: 45548 ServFail 0/0/0 (68)

Similarly for TXT record type

dig @192.168.35.17 euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in TXT
 
; <<>> DiG 9.3.6-P1-RedHat-9.3.6-16.P1.el5_7.1 <<>> @192.168.35.17 euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in TXT
; (1 server found)
;; global options:  printcmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 31814
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
 
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. IN TXT
 
;; Query time: 56 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.35.17#53(192.168.35.17)
;; WHEN: Wed Jun 13 00:43:21 2012
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 68

And tcpdump on the Master DNS server

tcpdump
00:45:13.182998 IP 192.168.35.15.48957 > 192.168.35.17.domain: 31814+ TXT? euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. (68)
00:45:13.183650 IP 192.168.35.17.60042 > 192.168.40.16.domain: 10672+ [1au] TXT? euca-192-168-61-110.eucalyptus.euca.jeevanullas.in. (79)
00:45:13.237261 IP 192.168.40.16.domain > 192.168.35.17.60042: 10672*- 1/1/1 A 192.168.61.110 (114)
00:45:13.237403 IP 192.168.35.17.domain > 192.168.35.15.48957: 31814 ServFail 0/0/0 (68)

Please let me know if there are any further questions.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: CLC always return A response for AAAA or TXT DNS query

comments.body: Thanks!
Eucalyptus's DNS server appears to respond with SERVFAIL status codes *every* time it encounters a request for which a matching record does not exist.  It should be responding with NXDOMAIN instead.
assigning to deependra pending update from the field
It might be worth seeing if holding an IPv6 address with global scope triggers the delay.

So, 

Can we please confirm this bug? What would be the possible release time frame when this could be fixed? Please let me know if further details are required (I hope that is not the case because all the required information is present with this report)

Cheers!
Deependra

Confirmed.

+ DNS server that is master (10.1.1.254)
+ CLCs ip addresses: 192.168.39.102, 192.168.39.101
+ DNS delegation setup

;
; NS records (Delegated zones)
;

euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com.       IN      NS      viking-01.eucalyptus-systems.com.
euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com.       IN      NS      viking-02.eucalyptus-systems.com.

viking-01       IN      A       192.168.39.101
viking-02       IN      A       192.168.39.102

(forwarding also set up)

*Steps to reproduce*

1) Run dig against public-hostname of instance requesting AAAA:


# dig @10.1.1.254 euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>> @10.1.1.254 euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com AAAA
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 9054
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN AAAA

;; Query time: 122 msec
;; SERVER: 10.1.1.254#53(10.1.1.254)
;; WHEN: Fri Jul  6 21:08:30 2012
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 81

2) Run dig against public-hostname of instance requesting TXT:

# dig @10.1.1.254 euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com TXT

; <<>> DiG 9.7.0-P1 <<>> @10.1.1.254 euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com TXT
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 35507
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-192-168-55-101.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN TXT

;; Query time: 141 msec
;; SERVER: 10.1.1.254#53(10.1.1.254)
;; WHEN: Fri Jul  6 21:08:48 2012
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 81

Ready for review. Basically since we don't support IPv6, if a AAAA request is seen, we'll answer with success and empty answer per RFC.

File   eucalyptus/clc/modules/dns/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/dns/SetResponse.java
commit 96e74ed5e5999633eeb77e52e9ac074aa7bb6dfa
Branches: team/clc-dev/EUCA-2329

commit b48435d6d7859f07aaa598a65b8751b9e0bfd80f
Branches: team/clc-dev/EUCA-2329

Branches: team/clc-dev/EUCA-2329

Test Cases:
{code}
1. Run the following on the node controller
------
[root@node] service dnsmasq stop
[root@node] echo "server=/chuck.org/192.168.51.164" >> /etc/dnsmasq.conf  <== Where the domain name is your configured domain name and IP is the cluster IP
[root@node] echo "server=/46.168.192.in-addr.arpa/192.168.51.164" >> /etc/dnsmasq.conf  <== Reverse domain lookup for 192.168.46.xxx
[root@node] service dnsmasq start

2. Run the following on the cluster controller
------
[root@cluster] service dnsmasq stop
[root@cluster] euca-modify-property -p system.dns.dnsdomain=chuck.org
[root@cluster] euca-modify-property -p bootstrap.webservices.use_instance_dns=true
[root@cluster] euca-modify-property -p bootstrap.webservices.use_dns_delegation=true
[root@cluster] euca-add-keypair chuck > chuck.private
[root@cluster] euca-run-instances emi-88AE3FDD -k chuck
[root@cluster] euca-describe-instances

INSTANCE	i-6918412B	emi-0F1B3D7F	euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org	euca-10-193-7-243.eucalyptus.internal	running	chuck	0		m1.small	2012-08-13T20:43:16.768Z	PARTI00	eki-6AB63B31	eri-EFFC36DF		monitoring-disabled	euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org	euca-10-193-7-243.eucalyptus.internal			instance-store	
[root@cluster]
 
3. Run the following on the node controller
------
[root@node] dig @192.168.51.165 euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org A

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.10.rc1.el6_3.2 <<>> @192.168.51.165 euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org A

;; Got answer:

[root@node] dig @192.168.51.165 euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.10.rc1.el6_3.2 <<>> @192.168.51.165 euca-192-168-46-44.eucalyptus.chuck.org AAAA

For some reason this came into QA and got merged out of testing??? Re-submitting it soon.
Ok, for some reason this made it back into testing. So it should be with out with 3.2
Checking are only in 3.1,  Need to put this into 3.2 testing
Files were checked into 3.2. For some reason it didn't reflect in the commit section. Just verified the fix is present in the code.
So which release will finally include this fix ?
Good question [~abckey] , i wonder why the scoping says 3.1.3 , which really does not exist.
This is targetted for 3.2.
Ran setup as per Chuck's test case.  Results of A, AAAA, and TXT dns requests were status: NOERROR, as oppsed to status: SERVFAIL

verification : not pass
versopm: EUCA3.2
step:
1. use dig setup a ipv6 DNS request
2, use tcpdump command trace result in euca dns-server,we could see euca still give ipv4 reply
[root@euca-mgmt-2 data]#  tcpdump -i bond0 -nn port 53
17:38:25.373855 IP 10.56.130.139.13831 > 10.69.153.7.53: 7153+ [1au] AAAA? walrus.ncep153.cd.nsn-rdnet.net. (60)
17:38:25.391215 IP 10.69.153.7.53 > 10.56.130.139.13831: 7153*- 1/1/1 A 10.69.153.6 (102)
3,see dig result in client server:
[root@NSN-Mgmt-1 ~]# dig @10.56.130.139 walrus.ncep153.cd.nsn-rdnet.net AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.10.rc1.el6 <<>> @10.56.130.139 walrus.ncep153.cd.nsn-rdnet.net AAAA
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 58253
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;walrus.ncep153.cd.nsn-rdnet.net. IN    AAAA

;; Query time: 39 msec
;; SERVER: 10.56.130.139#53(10.56.130.139)
;; WHEN: Fri Jan  4 17:38:25 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 49

When i tested, I did query the CLC directly and the server would return the NOERROR code. What I suspect here is that, while going through the DNS server directly, the CLC will return to the server the NOERROR code but may not include the empty answer section causing the DNS server to change the code from NOERROR to SERVFAIL. Looking into this at the moment.
Reopening for investigation.

Ok, I think I found the problem. The answer lies in the AUTHORITY section. If, for example, you own the 'chuck.org' domain and you configure eucalyptus to handle the 'eucalyptus.chuck.org' subdomain, the CLC will return the AUTHORITY answer for 'chuck.org' to the master DNS server which will get upset and return SERVFAIL rather than the NOERROR. 

The solution is to make sure that our DNS response include an authority section for the subdomain we manage and not for the base domain.
I tested a fix and merged it into the testing branch.

[~chuck] [~dshekhawat]

What is the definitive way to test for this one?

Hi Mike,

First start a single machine where you'll install named/bind on it. Once Bind is installed, create the /etc/named.conf file (included) and modify appropriately (as indicated in the file). You'll also need to copy and modify the other 2 files under /var/named/... Once ready, you can do "service named start" to start the DNS service. This will be your DNS server that handles the "mmunn1.org" domain and enything named after "*.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org" will be forwarded to the CLC and everything else will go to our internal DNS server to get resolved. Remove any ".txt" extension which was automatically added by my text editor

Once your DNS server is ready, you can start a cloud on other machine. Configure the DNS server to the IP of your DNS server (I think the default is 192.168.7.1). Also, go to the documentation pages and follow the instruction to configure DNS on eucalyptus. Should be straight forward.

-Chuck

Test passed:

root@i:~# cat /etc/resolv.conf
domain eucalyptus.internal
search eucalyptus.internal
nameserver 192.168.51.191
nameserver 192.168.51.191
root@i:~# 
root@i:~# 
root@i:~# dig euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org A

; <<>> DiG 9.8.1-P1 <<>> euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org A
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 1763
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 4, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org. IN A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org. 604733 IN A 10.111.101.57

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.	1	IN	NS	c-09.qa1.eucalyptus.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.
eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.	1	IN	NS	c-09.qa1.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.
eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.	1	IN	NS	root.eucalyptus.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.
eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.	1	IN	NS	root.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.

;; Query time: 1 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.51.191#53(192.168.51.191)
;; WHEN: Wed May 29 18:15:21 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 169

root@i:~# 
root@i:~# dig euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org AAAA

; <<>> DiG 9.8.1-P1 <<>> euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org AAAA
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 27480
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-10-111-101-57.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org. IN AAAA

;; AUTHORITY SECTION:
eucalyptus.mmunn1.org.	10800	IN	SOA	root.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org. c-09.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.eucalyptus.mmunn1.org. 1 86400 604800 2419200 600

;; Query time: 146 msec
;; SERVER: 192.168.51.191#53(192.168.51.191)
;; WHEN: Wed May 29 18:15:25 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 131

root@i:~#
Resolved in the 3.3.0 release
